public class StreamByteReader
extends AbstractByteReader

Class providing common functionality for reading streams.

This class cannot be instantiated (there is no constructor).

linb

Method Detail

readStream

protected void readStream(InputStream inStream)
                   throws IOException
Read stream into a ByteBuffer or temporary file.

This method allocates a buffer, and then attempts to read the stream into it. If the buffer isn't big enough, the contents of it are transferred to a temporary file, and then the rest of the stream is appended to this file.

After this method has been called, the field tempFile is null if the contents of the stream could fit into the buffer, and is the created temporary file otherwise.

Parameters:
inStream - the stream to read in.
Throws:
IOException - if there is an error writing to the temporary file

setFileMarker

public void setFileMarker(long markerPosition)
Position the file marker at a given byte position.

The file marker is used to record how far through the file the byte sequence matching algorithm has got.

Parameters:
markerPosition - The byte number in the file at which to position the marker
